content.question: A differentiable function f has the property that <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mn>5</mn> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B29@</annotation> </semantics> </math> and <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mi>f</mi> <mo>â€²</mo> </msup> <mrow><mo>(</mo> <mn>5</mn> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B36@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. What is the estimate for <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mn>4.8</mn> </mrow> <mo>)</mo></mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3AD9@</annotation> </semantics> </math> using the local linear approximation for f at x= 5 ?
